summary.para: Defines stream buffer parameters that may change from one call to the next. Used with the method.

remarks.para: Although the format and maximum size values of a particular stream buffer are constant, as defined by the structure, the actual memory address of the stream buffer is permitted to change. For constant-bit-rate (CBR) XAPOs, ValidFrameCount is constant and is always equal to the corresponding XAPO_LOCKFORPROCESS_BUFFER_PARAMETERS.MaxFrameCount for this buffer.
Note Only constant-bit-rate XAPOs are currently supported.
Windows 10 (XAudio2.9); Windows 8, Windows Phone 8 (XAudio 2.8); DirectX SDK (XAudio 2.7)

summary.para: Pointer to a stream buffer that contains audio data. The buffer must be 16-byte aligned, non-NULL, and must be at least .MaxFrameCount frames in size.
An enumeration describing the contents of the stream buffer.
Number of frames to process; this value must be within the range 0 to .MaxFrameCount.
